title: Interpreting the Problem
text: We are trying to determine where $$y<0$$, which is when $$-\left(\frac{1}{2}\right) |4x-5|+3<0$$.
speech: We are trying to determine where  y is less than 0 , which is when  negative 1 half the absolute value of 4 x minus 5, end absolute value plus 3 is less than 0 .
pacedSpeech: We are trying to determine where   y is less than 0
, which is when   negative 1 half the absolute value of 4 x minus 5, end absolute value plus 3 is less than 0

title: Isolating the Absolute Value
text: We can subtract $$3$$ from both side, then multiply both sides by $$-2$$, which gives us $$|4x-5|>6$$.
speech: We can subtract  3  from both side, then multiply both sides by  negative 2 , which gives us  the absolute value of 4 x minus 5, end absolute value is greater than 6 .
pacedSpeech: from both side, then multiply both sides by   negative 2
, which gives us   the absolute value of 4 x minus 5, end absolute value is greater than 6

title: Solve Equality
text: We proceed to solve for the equality $$|4x-5|=6$$.
speech: We proceed to solve for the equality  the absolute value of 4 x minus 5, end absolute value is equal to 6 .
pacedSpeech: We proceed to solve for the equality   the absolute value of 4 x minus 5, end absolute value is equal to 6

title: Solve Equality
text: We can write out $$|4x-5|=6$$ as $$4x-5=6$$ and $$4x-5=-6$$
speech: We can write out  the absolute value of 4 x minus 5, end absolute value is equal to, 6  as  4 x, minus 5 is equal to, 6  and  4 x, minus 5 is equal to negative 6
pacedSpeech: We can write out   the absolute value of 4 x minus 5, end absolute value is equal to, 6
as   4 x, minus 5 is equal to, 6
and   4 x, minus 5 is equal to negative 6

title: Solve Equality
speech: Solve  4 x minus 5, is equal to 6 . What is  x ?
pacedSpeech: Solve   4 x minus 5, is equal to 6

title: Solve Equality
speech: Solve  4 x minus 5, is equal to, negative 6 . What is  x ?
pacedSpeech: Solve   4 x minus 5, is equal to, negative 6

title: Examine Graph
text: Now, we can examine the graph to observe where the y-values are negative. We observe where the branches are below the x-axis. Notice that it is not important exactly what the graph looks like, as long as we know that it crosses the horizontal axis at $$x=\frac{-1}{4}$$ and x=11/4,and that the graph opens downward.\n##figure1.gif##
